;Brief Analysis

;

; "Qiantang has been prosperous since ancient times." Especially in the Southern Song Dynasty, Hangzhou was the capital. After more than a hundred years of management, it became a rare and beautiful city in the world at that time. This "Hangzhou Scene" is a famous work praising Hangzhou's beautiful scenery and bustling city. [A Flower] describes the historical changes of Hangzhou and the prosperity of the city; [Liangzhou Seventh] describes the beautiful scenery of Hangzhou in detail; [End] praises the beautiful scenery of Hangzhou. The author uses clear and natural language and a pleasant and admiring style to describe the "enviable" splendid scenery of Hangzhou, as well as the prosperous scene of "scattered pavilions" and "crowded people" in Hangzhou. The words and lines are full of the author's deep love for the mountains and rivers of the motherland. The work uses narrative techniques to describe the scenes in a detailed, vivid and characteristic way.

;On the River

;[Song Dynasty] Wang Anshi
;The autumn clouds in the north of the Yangtze River are half open, and the evening clouds contain rain but linger low. (Wan Yun's first work: Xiao Yun)
;The green mountains are surrounded by no way, and suddenly I see thousands of sails looming.
;

;Translation and annotations

;

;

;;Translation
;;North of the river, half of the thick autumn clouds have been torn apart by the autumn wind; The heavy rainy clouds moved slowly.
;The green mountains on both sides of the bank were overlapping and twisting, seeming to block the way of the river. The boat turned a corner and saw the endless river again, with white sails on the river gradually approaching.

;

;;Notes
;;Wan Yun: One work is "Xiao Yun". Low wandering: This refers to thick dark clouds moving slowly. Wandering means "hui".
;Wrap around: rotate in a loop.
;Hidden reflection: faintly revealed.

;

;

;Creative background

;

; This poem was written after Wang Anshi's one-day trip to the Yangtze River after he resigned and retired to Jinling after the failure of the political reform.

;

;Appreciation

;

;

; In his later years, Wang Anshi lived in Zhongshan, Jinling, "reciting poems and talking about Buddhism" (Su Shi's words), pursuing peace of mind. In line with this, a large number of elegant and delicate quatrains appeared in his creations. In this condensed and light form, he expressed his calm and tranquil mood. This little poem is an example of this.

;

; Poems about the scenery seen while boating on the river. I wrote about the autumn clouds, the clouds and the rain, the green mountains and the shadowy sails in the distance. They are all very open and grand objects. However, the artistic realm created by the whole poem is not majestic and heroic, but empty and dim. , the key lies in the word far. The poet took in various distant views to compose his picture. In the sentence "The autumn clouds in the north of the Yangtze River are half open", after the rain, the sky is clear, the clouds are half open, and a touch of blue sky has brought the glow of the sunset, giving people a distant feeling. The sentence "The evening clouds contain rain but linger low" brings the clouds at dusk to life. "Low wandering" originally refers to people's wandering and contemplation, but here it is used to express the low and slow movement of rainy dusk clouds, which is full of interest and movement in silence. In these two sentences, the poet outlines a picture of autumn river and dusk clouds. It has the hazy and implicit beauty of Mijia's landscape. The picture is not bright and clear, but seems to be deliberately pursuing a state of half-light and half-darkness, with divine light coming and going: the gloomy autumn sky is not entirely cheerful but "half-open". It can be seen that the light is not too bright; the clouds in the evening are not bright and bright, but have a rainy feel. They are not the rolling black clouds before the storm, but they are low and calm, leisurely and quiet. Therefore, remoteness and elegance have become the keynote of this picture.

;

; The third and fourth sentences move from the clouds to the green mountains by the river. The mountains are tangled and winding, as if they are blocking the poet's way forward. However, the shadows of sails that flicker in the distance are telling The poet has a long future and endless roads. These two sentences describe the special feelings of traveling by the river. There are not only scenery, but also people in the scenery. There is meaning in the scenery. They contain profound philosophy in the ordinary scenery, which is thought-provoking and thought-provoking. Later, Lu You's famous sentence "The mountains are poor and the rivers are doubtful and there is no way out, but the willows are dark and the flowers are bright and there is another village." This is the famous sentence that originated from this. The twists and turns of the green mountains here, and the disappearing and appearing of the sail shadow, also constitute a distant picture, which is integrated with the above two sentences. The deeper meaning of this poem is not to submit to darkness, but to resist darkness. Resisting the darkness can open up the perspective of thousands of sails racing. This is a certain philosophy of life or political philosophy that the poet experienced through the changes in the mountains and waters. Therefore, this poem is based on dialectical thinking.

;

; When Su Shi commented on Wang Wei's poems and paintings, he said that "there are paintings in poems, and there are poems in paintings", combining the poetic realm with the artistic conception. The close combination of poetry and painting was perfectly combined in the landscape poetry and paintings of the Tang Dynasty. The landscape pastoral poems of Wang Wei, Meng Haoran and others all have the temperament and charm of painting. The landscape poetry and paintings of the Tang Dynasty focused on the beauty of nature. The landscape paintings of the Song Dynasty emphasized quality and expressed real life through temporal order and layout. Landscape poems also advocated freshness and implication, requiring true feelings to be expressed through objective description. Wang Anshi's landscape poems grasp this point very well. This poem about a trip to the river lays out a broad picture on a gray background, supplemented by deep brushwork, which is consistent with Mi Fu's landscape painting techniques, expressing an implicit and hazy beauty. At the same time, the poet expressed his melancholy about the long journey and the changing winds through the description of the scenery, and added subjective thoughts to the landscape poem, enriching the theme of the poem.

Ouyang Xiu praised Wang Anshi: "There are three thousand romantic poems in the Imperial Academy and two hundred years of articles in the official department. I still have self-pity in my old age, and who will compete with my son in the future." The handed down collections of works include "Wang Linchuan Collection", "Linchuan Collection Supplements" and so on. He is good at all styles of poetry and prose. Although he does not have many words, he is also good at it. He has famous works such as "Guizhixiang" and so on. The most popular poem by Wang Jinggong is "The spring breeze is green again on the south bank of the river. When will the bright moon shine back on me?" in "Boancing at Guazhou".
